Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Improve the color contrast of the header's search button" (#8266) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Updates the orange button's color such that its color contrast is at least 3:1 on both our body's and header's background colors. Currently, the color is dark enough on our white background, but too dark for our blue background.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8265

Screenshot:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/96027883-6b26ca00-0e0d-11eb-882b-dec3748bf78a.png)

üí° Pro tip: Chrome may render different colors than requested by the stylesheet (see [this StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48642753/css-color-difference-between-browsers)). If you work on color contrast accessibility issues using Chrome, make sure to disable this behavior here: chrome://flags/

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/96028119-c062db80-0e0d-11eb-8ffb-8337b964d762.png)

Here is an excerpt from WCAG 2.1 ([here](https://w3c.github.io/wcag21/guidelines/#dfn-contrast-ratio)):

> WCAG conformance should be evaluated for color pairs specified in the content that an author would expect to appear adjacent in typical presentation. Authors need not consider unusual presentations, such as color changes made by the user agent, except where caused by authors' code.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Improve color contrast of grey buttons" (#8259) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8192

Example:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/95800326-dfe1f300-0cab-11eb-8e3d-265f8d81a241.png)

Hovering over the button darkens it:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/95800561-83cb9e80-0cac-11eb-8f38-10ff56246ce1.png)

Note: this change also affects external login buttons. The new style is closer to Microsoft's [guidelines](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/howto-add-branding-in-azure-ad-apps#visual-guidance-for-sign-in) but does not follow them completely. I've opened https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8258 to track this issue.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/95800471-48c96b00-0cac-11eb-8bc5-a54e29189069.png)

You can find the test plan here: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8192#issuecomment-698598530

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][Contrast]"Organizations"  and "upload" Menu item are not visible in high contrast black" (#8187) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1184516

## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450)

## Repro Steps:

    Turn on High contrast Black mode
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "Manage Organizations" and Press enter
    Check whether all the text in the page is clearly visible and"Organizations"  and "upload" Menu item are  visible in high contrast black or not

## Actual Results:
"Organizations"  and "upload" Menu item are not visible in high contrast black
## Expected Results:
"Organizations"  and "upload" Menu item should be visible in high contrast black mode
## User Impact:
high contrast users may find difficulty to see the "Organizations" link and 'Upload" menu item

## Notes
There should be high contrast settings in the Styles. Identifying which are used here, or adding new ones for the given scenario will be required for fix.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove A/B test for package dependents feature" (#8250) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This feature has been running successfully for several months. We no longer need the A/B test check. The existing feature flag can remain for emergency scenarios.

Found via tweet:
https://twitter.com/DonBeham/status/1313766887285764096

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][ARIA]Label name is not given at the control for the 'Select new member role' and 'change member role' dropdowns" (#8193) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188120
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Repro Steps:

    Change the Display resolution to 1280*1024 in System display settings
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "Manage organizations" and Press enter
    Tab till "Edit " present in any record the table and press enter
    Tab till Members and expand it 
    Tab till 'Select new member role' and verify the visual name is given or not

## Actual Results:
Label name is not given visually for the 'Select new member role' and 'change member role' dropdowns

## Expected Results:
Label name which is announcing by the screen reader for the Select new member role' and Change member role' should be given as visually. 
## User Impact:
Speech input users will face the issue as they may not be able to access this two dropdowns  

## Notes
Another aria-label fix. Should be fairly straightforward to fix. I don't believe the display resolution adjustment is necessary to repro.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Fix for overflowing api key hint text on certain zoom levels." (#8215) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses #8190 

It seems that at some point, in order to align the bottoms of the package list and the API key hint container their respective heights were explicitly specified in CSS (see diff). At certain zoom levels (and browser window widths) the contents of the hint container gets longer than the container permits and overflows:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102933/93840558-a76b6e00-fc45-11ea-9bca-1dc256a8f7ee.png)

In order to get rid of hardcoding container heights a bunch of flex containers were introduced, hint container was wrapped with an additional `<div class="form-group">` in order to layout the contents in the same way as in the container on the left (i.e. to have the same margin-bottom), so bottom border end up on the same level.
At the same time, table inside the hint container was styled to not have a bottom margin to eliminate weird white space:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102933/93840762-60ca4380-fc46-11ea-93b0-f01a5ab08a62.png)

Resulting in the following look (at various widths and zoom levels):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102933/93840999-1b5a4600-fc47-11ea-9506-24e198063a39.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102933/93841035-375de780-fc47-11ea-887a-371c92aaf7a1.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102933/93841076-59f00080-fc47-11ea-9bcc-be2d121a2ddb.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][Contrast]Color contrast for the "Copy" button's background with page background ratio is 2.5:1 which is less than 3:1" (#8195) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188278
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Note:
Same issue is observed at Search button and for the stars in the table
## Repro Steps:

    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Profile" button in the menu bar and press enter
    Tab till any Manage packages"  and press enter.
    Tab till search bar and search for 'Json' and press enter 
    Tab till the first result "Newtonsoft.Json" and press enter 
    Tab till "Copy" button and  Check whether the color contrast for the background to icon is greater than equal to 3:1 or not

## Actual Results:

Color contrast for the background to focus on the icons Facebook and Twitter is which is less than 3:1.

   
## Expected Results:
Color contrast for the "Copy" button's background with page background ratio is 2.5:1 which is less than 3:1
## User Impact:
Users with low vision would face difficulty to identify the elements if the non-text contrast is less than 3:1

## Notes
This looks similar to https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8192
A global fix for this button type should be made.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][Contrast]Color contrast for the focus on icons Facebook and Twitter with background is 1.658 which is less than 3:1" (#8185) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1184494
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450)


## Repro Steps:

    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Packages tab" item and press enter
    Tab till any package and press enter.
    Tab till "Share" section
    Check whether the color contrast for the background to focus on the icons "Facebook" and "Twitter" greater than or equal to 3:1

## Actual Results:

Color contrast for the focus on icons Facebook and Twitter with background is 1.658 which is less than 3:1

   
## Expected Results:
Color contrast for the focus on icons Facebook and Twitter with background is 1.658 it should be greater than or equal to 3:1
## User Impact:
Users with low vision would face difficulty to identify the elements if the non-text contrast is less than 3:1

## Notes
We don't control these icons. I don't know if we are allowed to/should change them.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][ARIA]NVDA is not reading the label name for the 'Select Scopes' checkboxes" (#8182) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1184483

## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)
Edge Dev: Version 86.0.601.1 (Official build) dev (64-bit)
Screen Reader: NVDA, Narrator

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450)


## Repro Steps:

    Turn on NVDA.
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "API Keys" and Press enter
    Tab till "Create button" and press enter
    Tab till "Select scopes" section
    Check whether NVDA is reading the label name for the 'Select Scopes' 

## Actual Results:

NVDA is not reading the label name for the 'Select Scopes' Checkboxes

## Expected Results:
NVDA should read the label name for the "Select Scopes"  
## User Impact:
Users with visual disabilities may not understand the information clearly if screen reader doesn't read the label names

## Notes:
Check the aria-label or aria-labelled-by property on the scopes. Chances are, this isn't labelled correctly.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "props file of nuget VC++ (native) package is not added to ExtensionSettings import group" (#10125) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1002251/props-file-of-nuget-vc-native-package-is-not-added.html)._ --- If I add a nuget package to a VC++ project (vcxproj), the props file from packages build\native folder is not added to the ``. Instead the import is placed at the beginnig of the project file. The targets file instead is correctly added to the ``. The positioning of build customizations is defined here: [ExtensionSettings ImportGroup element](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/build/reference/vcxproj-file-structure?view=vs-2019#extensionsettings-importgroup-element). Thank you for fixing this. --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 4/23/2020, 00:43 AM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

#### kapenaga [MSFT] on 5/5/2020, 05:54 PM:

Unable to reproduce this issue on the following installation of Visual Studio. Can you please upload a sample project to reproduce this issue?

Microsoft Visual Studio Professional 2019
Version 16.3.10
VisualStudio.16.Release/16.3.10+29519.87

#### Jojakim Stahl on 5/11/2020, 03:15 AM:

Attached I sent you an example for this. The project history is included, you can see how it evolves in the git log.

What I did:

  1. Create a new VC++ Console App
  2. Create a new Sample package with props and targets file (see in folder SamplePackage)
  3. Build the sample package with "nuget pack"
  4. Add the SamplePackage folder to the package sources in Visual Studio
  5. Add the Package "Sample" to the Console App project. That inserts the import of the props file as the first line of the vcxproj file.

consoleapplication3.zip

Hope this helps to track down the problem.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Selecting "install with package manager" opens NuGet to wrong tab" (#10124) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1218224/selecting-install-with-package-manager-opens-nuget.html)._ --- When editing my .NET app if a Roslyn analyzer appears with a helpful suggestion that the code I am attempting to write is not possible because I am missing a package and gives me a helpful suggestion to "install with package manager" it then tries to open NuGet manager. This is where I hit a problem that I could reproduce easily. If the last time I used package manager I left my tab on for example "installed" it would be the tab that the analyzer would open and try to search for the missing package. This would show no results. But obviously it should have switched to "Browser" since the package was not in my solution. --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 10/14/2020, 03:31 AM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

#### Feedback Bot on 10/14/2020, 01:04 PM:

Thanks for creating this issue! We figured it‚Äôs covering the same as another one we already have. Thus, we closed this one as a duplicate. We‚Äôve transferred all votes from this ticket to the other one. For more information, see also our issue reporting guidelines.

Happy coding!

#### kapenaga [MSFT] on 10/14/2020, 02:05 PM:

This issue is currently being investigated and could be because of another one we already have. Our team will get back to you if either more information is needed, a workaround is available, or the issue is resolved.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "BitmapImageCache expiration policy can vary by Status" (#10123) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3702, a [BitmapImageCache](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/fc7040a568c576511d0546209666d12e0c1503ba/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/Models/PackageItemListViewModel.cs) was added with a SlidingExpiration of 10 minutes. This doesn't make sense for some statuses that are more final.

### I commented https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3702#discussion_r504893688:

I think we can be more conservative with the refresh, right? Isn't it almost impossible for icons to change on an existing package? Is this about retrying more often when there's a transient network error?

Maybe the policy should vary by Status? Network errors may resolve. Decoding errors probably won't? RelativeURLs "never" will.
`DefaultIconDueToNetworkFailures`
`DefaultIconDueToWebExceptionBadNetwork`
10 mins

`DefaultIconDueToDecodingError`
60 mins?

`DefaultIconDueToRelativeUri`
NEVER


@rrelyea replied that we could followup here:
> this is an interesting topic. When the error gate has too many errors, we never try again for that instance of pm ui. i'd prefer to keep current behavior for now.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PM UI Icon Status could be indicated with an Overlay on Default Icon" (#10122) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
A recent PR https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3702 by @rrelyea adds Statuses ([IconBitmapStatus](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/fc7040a568c576511d0546209666d12e0c1503ba/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/Models/IconBitmapStatus.cs)) for why an icon failed to load.
It may be worth considering adding some overlays to the Default Package  icons, so it's clear why an icon failed to load (is it because the client is offline? Issue with the package itself? Or just no icon for this package?)

For accessibility and clarity, adding a tooltip explaining the status would be warranted.

I proposed on a whim something like these for Network issues:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/96029726-0da07680-0e29-11eb-95f2-ed6c6007649e.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/96029902-49d3d700-0e29-11eb-9bbc-a0c8349f6e25.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Address mutations in cacheContext" (#10121) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Maybe it's not urgent now, but  just in case I creating this issue:
Currently we have many `cacheContext`s which used for caching some previous values and calculations.
But they're using mutable normal dictionary which makes very hard for adding parallelization into our code as I experienced in [PR#3605](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3605) and [PR#3646](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3646).
Solution would be change them to `concurrent` type dictionaries or add sync lock. But caveat is `concurrent` types are slower than normal ones because it checks for sync locks. So one hand we're making things little bit faster due to parallelization but other hand making some things slower for other uses, there're 2 sides of coin, hard to evaluate right away.
We can't make it immutable types because most cache are intended for mutation. 
Another issue is almost all `cacheContext`s are part of public API. Not sure how to handle it without breaking. One possible solution is create new ones and deprecate old ones.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The 'Package' Build tab specifies an icon using a property that was deprecated by NuGet" (#10120) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/793034/the-package-build-tab-specifies-an-icon-using-a-pr.html)._ --- When building a C# library, in project properties -> Package tab, we specify all the properties for the package. Here we can specify an icon for the package. The only way to specify the icon in this tab is by filling the 'Icon URL' text box. This generates a NuGet package with the 'iconUrl' tag, which was deprecated by NuGet and that gives a warning when uploading to NuGet. --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 10/25/2019, 01:04 AM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

#### Feedback Bot on 11/11/2019, 00:36 PM:

This issue is currently being investigated. Our team will get back to you if either more information is needed, a workaround is available, or the issue is resolved.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)

Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): -

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): -

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): -

VS version (if appropriate): -

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): -

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: -

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Click link
2. Link doesn't go to Windows 10 SDK download page

## Other suggested things

I submitted a PR to fix here https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3697

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...) -

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue! -
